Topic.Title: BUY OR SELL?

Message.Msg: There is absolutely no chance that asteroid 2012 DA14 will hit Earth when it makes its closest approach on Friday (Feb. 15), but many other asteroids like it have made a crash landing on the planet in the past. Although the 150-foot (45 meters) space rock is nowhere near as large as the asteroid thought thought to have killed off the dinosaurs — that behemoth was likely about 6 miles (10 kilometers) wide — it could still cause some serious damage, experts say. The asteroid is about 150 feet in diameter and has a mass estimated at about 143,000 tons. It would cause a blast with the energy equivalent of about 2.4 million tons — or 2.4 megatons — of TNT explosives, more than 180 times the power of the atomic blast that leveled Hiroshima. Not the end of the world. It could land in North Korea.

Message.Title: Piper Jaffray raises price target
Message.Msg: Cisco price target raised ahead of Q2 results at Piper Jaffray Piper Jaffray raised its price target for Cisco shares to $25 from $22 ahead of the company's Q2 results and reiterates an Overweight rating on the stock. Piper expects Cisco to report modest revenue and earnings upside in Q2 coupled with improving tone from CEO John Chambers. The firm continues to recommend the stock as one of its favorite large cap ideas.

Topic.Title: TED NUGENT = DORNER

Message.Msg: The actual text of the law says something anal about leaving the country to do the same thing. The lawyers who write most of our laws are pretty meticulous about making sure they define the offense they intend to prosecute. The law was intended to curtail sex tourism emanating from the United States, but there are still states in the United States where sex is legal with girls as young as 16. You just can't "travel" to those states for that purpose. The law also mentions forign destinations, and doesn't rely on casual web culture definitions of what a state line is, or is not.
